inlineContent.text: We aim to build our effects in a way that it’s easy and intuitive to use. However, this might not always be possible so in this article we want to exaplain to you the basic effect configuration options (meaning: parameters of
files) that you can use for each and every effect of our package.
If there’s still things remaining unclear, feel free to contact us for clarification.
Options (Unordered, oldest first, oldest last, back to front, additive). It defines how emitter cells are rendered into the view.
(Birthrate): An animatable property that increments the particle cells.
An animatable property that multiplies the particle cells’ velocity. The default value is

Scale: Defines a multiplier applied to the cell-defined particle scale. Use the range of
Speed. NB: Different from the velocity settings

abstract.text: This article gives an overview over the configuration options that are common for all affects in the package.
This is a library for creating full screen effects in SwiftUI in an easy, seamless way. The package is available on Swift Package Manager (SPM) and fully open-source.
